page.title:

• Means “scarring of the liver”

page.title:
Treatment of Chronic Hepatitis C
Treatment of Chronic
Hepatitis C

Goals of Treatment
Goals of Treatment
page.enlisting:
• Clear all the hepatitis C virus from the body • Slow or stop damage to the liver • Help decrease symptoms • Clear all the hepatitis C virus from the body
• Clear all the hepatitis C virus from the body
• Slow or stop damage to the liver
• Slow or stop damage to the liver
• Help decrease symptoms
• Help decrease symptoms
(“sustained response”)
(“sustained response”)

page.title:
What Treatment is Available?
What Treatment is
Available?
page.enlisting:
• Interferon – Given by shot, usually 3 times a week • Pegylated interferon – Long-acting, taken once a week • Combination therapy – Interferon (standard or pegylated) taken with – Ribavirin is a pill taken twice daily • Interferon
• Interferon
– Given by shot, usually 3 times a week
– Given by shot, usually 3 times a week
• Pegylated interferon

– Long-acting, taken once a week
– Long-acting, taken once a week

• Combination therapy

– Interferon (standard or pegylated) taken with
– Ribavirin is a pill taken twice daily

ribavirin
ribavirin

page.title:
Does Treatment Work?
Does Treatment Work?
page.enlisting:
• Interferon alone: – 10 – 15% chance of clearing the virus from the blood • Interferon & ribavirin: – Up to 40% chance of clearing the virus • Pegylated interferon alone: – About the same as interferon & ribavirin 40% • Pegylated interferon & ribavirin: – Up to 50% chance of clearing the virus • Interferon alone:
• Interferon alone:
– 10 – 15% chance of clearing the virus from the blood
– 10 – 15% chance of clearing the virus from the blood
• Interferon & ribavirin:
• Interferon & ribavirin:
– Up to 40% chance of clearing the virus
– Up to 40% chance of clearing the virus
• Pegylated interferon alone:
• Pegylated interferon alone:
– About the same as interferon & ribavirin 40%
– About the same as interferon & ribavirin 40%
• Pegylated interferon & ribavirin:
• Pegylated interferon & ribavirin:
– Up to 50% chance of clearing the virus
– Up to 50% chance of clearing the virus

page.title:
During Treatment
During Treatment

• Medications taken for either 6 or 12 months • Blood testing required 2 to 3 times the first • Clinic visits every 1 month • Interferon must be refrigerated • We must have a way to contact you • Medications taken for either 6 or 12 months
• Medications taken for either 6 or 12 months
• Blood testing required 2 to 3 times the first
• Blood testing required 2 to 3 times the first
• Clinic visits every 1 month
• Clinic visits every 1 month
• Interferon must be refrigerated
• Interferon must be refrigerated

• We must have a way to contact you
month, then every 4 weeks
month, then every 4 weeks
